intro: Syngonanthus phelpsiae var. viridis, commonly known as the green-flowered phelpsia, is a rare and unique variant of the phelpsia species. It is characterized by its striking green flowers, which contrast with its typical foliage. This plant is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and distinctive floral characteristics. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
